title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Monday 13 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: cars damaged in valley as fallen are remembered on fell top .
police open bins for weapons surrender .
county seeks savings by getting nhs to pay for more .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and other items from around the county for today .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it again from 08:00 tomorrow .
if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: slippers heaped to mark launch of heating appeal
text: cumbria community foundation has launched its annual winter warmth appeal with a of 300 pairs of slippers .
the charity says it represents the 300 old people estimated to die before their time each year in cumbria because of the cold .
since it started in 2010 , the appeal has raised £ 630,000 to contribute to the heating bills of families struggling to find the money .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : milder with drizzle
text: it will be less cold than last night and cloudier .
there will be outbreaks of rain or drizzle for most places , with temperatures falling at worst to about 3c ( 37f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: theft 'could hit barrow company hard '
text: a burglary at specialist grounds maintenance company could have a `` significant impact '' on the business , according to police .

the thieves broke into clear track at sowerby woods business park in barrow , and made off with chainsaws , chipping equipment , two trailers , and an unusual land rover defender with a tipping back , registration ro12 wlk .
police say they 're keen to hear from anyone with information about the raid , which happened between 21:00 last thursday and friday morning .

documents.title: travel : a590 blocked by crash at greenodd
text: the a590 is blocked near the greenodd roundabout , between ulverston and newby bridge , after a crash involving two cars .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: heirloom guns 'could be used by criminals '
text: old firearms are increasingly being sought by criminals , according to an expert in policing from the university of cumbria .

iain stainton was speaking on the day cumbria police began a campaign to encourage people to surrender weapons , with a promise that no prosecutions for mere possession would result from handing in guns , knives , or other offensive items .
mr stainton said a deactivated firearm could be used to threaten people in a robbery , or even be put back into use .
something that might have been antique , handed down the generations , somebody could apply their skills to recommissioning those weapons . ''

documents.title: police seek vandals who ran over cars
text: police are trying to tace two young men and a young woman who were seen filming each other running across car roofs in schneider road , barrow , at about 05:00 on saturday .

documents.title: consultant honoured for medical education
text: a consultant psychiatrist has been awarded a fellowship at the academy of medical educators , the only clinician in the county to be given such recognition .
the academy 's an international body and dr samuel dearman , who is director of medical education at the trust , said he was `` honoured as well as a bit humbled to be accepted as a fellow '' .

documents.title: four schoolboys accused of 'gang rape ' on girl
text: four schoolboys have gone on trial accused of what 's been described as the `` gang rape '' of a 15-year-old girl in a field in workington .
the boys , all under the age of 16 , all deny two charges alleging rape and a third of an additional sexual assault .
tim evans , prosecuting at carlisle crown court , said a `` pack mentality '' had taken over , with the boys `` taking it in turns and sometimes arguing over their turns . ''
the issue in the trial , mr evans said , would be consent .
the boys can not be identified because of their ages .
the victim has lifetime anonymity .
the trial continues .

documents.title: thirlmere zip wire plans go in to national park authority
text: detailed plans for one of the most controversial developments to be proposed in the lake district this year have been lodged with the lake district national park authority today .
it is for an activity hub at thirlmere , including two zip wires about 1km long across the lake .

the scheme , which would include a cycle track around the lake , is being put forward by treetop trek , the company that already runs a high level ropes course with zip wires on a smaller scale at the brockhole national park visitor centre .
it 's attracted hundreds of comments on social media run by the company , and objectors .

documents.title: habourside site bought ahead of revamp
text: habourside site bought ahead of revamp

documents.title: give us time , says barrow 's holt after first outing
text: barrow 's new player-coach grant holt says it will take time for manager ady pennock to get the bluebirds away from the national league relegation zone .
the cumbrian team are only in the bottom four by a point - despite saturday 's 2-0 defeat at home to macclesfield .
but holt says fans should n't expect things to turn around overnight .
i 've only been here two days and the gaffer 's only been here two weeks . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: food firms may be offered quick planning system
text: food producers in eden may be offered a streamlined planning system for packing or processing facilities on seven business estates in the district .

the areas in appleby ( penrith , and kirkby stephen will be subject to local development orders meaning schemes that meet a simple set of guidelines will effectively have `` up-front '' planning permission .
edens one of 15 councils in the country piloting the system , which is supposed to make it easier for food firms to expand and create more jobs .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloud moving in , some rain
text: it will become increasingly cloudy through the afternoon with outbreaks of rain arriving .
these may fall as snow over the lake district and pennines .
it will feel cold with a maximum temperature of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingwoman dies after sedbergh house fire
text: an elderly woman has died after she was rescued from her home in sedbergh .
firefighters from sedbergh , kendal and kirby lonsdale were called to the house in bainbridge road just after 13:30 on saturday .
the woman was flown to the regional burns centre at whythenshaw hospital in manchester by the north west air ambulance , but she died from her injuries .
a spokesman for cumbria fire and rescue said the woman had raised the alarm herself by pressing a button on an alert pendant , and the first crew had arrived within five minutes .

documents.title: cumbrian charity shop rescued by web sales
text: the charity oxfam says its ulverston shop has gone from near closure to one of its best performers in the country , thanks to its volume of online selling .
the shop currently has more than 7,500 items listed online , and as orders come in they are packed and despatched by volunteers .
the shops had been close to closure , but the web sales have saved the business .
oxfam says this is good for donors who can be more certain that items dropped off will be sold , and for the charity which gets a greater income to fund its work .
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: five treated after egremont kitchen fire
text: five people suffering the effects of smoke were taken to hospital after fire broke out at a house in egremont early this morning .
cumbria fire service says it was called after 02:00 to the kitchen fire on greendykes , and firefighters checked neighbouring properties after treating those in the house .

documents.title: carlisle united 4-0 yeovil town
text: carlisle united 4-0 yeovil town

documents.title: cars damaged as walkers attend fell remembrance service
text: four cars parked along a lane in seathwaite were damaged this weekend as a remembrance service was being held at the war memorial on top of great gable .
the top of great gable was given to the national trust by the fell and rock climbing club in 1924 , and a plaque was placed on the summit listing the names of 20 members killed in world war one .
up to 300 people attended the service there .
it 's not known whether the car owners were at the service .
police say they believe the damage may have been done by a tractor and trailer , and they are asking for witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: barrow 0-2 macclesfield town
text: barrow 0-2 macclesfield town

documents.title: police promise anonymity for weapons hand-in
text: cumbria police is calling on people to hand in firearms , knives and ammunition as part of what they are describing as a a weapons surrender .
police say some illegal weapons are held in innocence because people do n't know having them is against the law , but others are held and used by criminals .
anyone handing in a weapon to police stations in workington , whitehaven , kendal , barrow , penrith and carlisle can stay anonymous , and will not face prosecution for illegal possession .
anyone handing in weapons will not automatically be charged , but will be if they are later connected to a crime .
last year 's surrender saw 300 weapons , including 216 knives , handed in to cumbria police .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : increasing cloud , snow on peaks
text: weather on the fell tops : increasing cloud , snow on peaks

documents.title: county looks to nhs to pay more elderly care bills
text: cumbria county council says it 's going to push harder for the nhs to pay for a wider range of care in an effort to save money .
the council needs to save £ 27m from its day-to-day spending next financial year and believes it is paying for some adult care that the nhs should be paying for .

the nhs says it works closely with the council and it hopes there will continue to be a collaborative approach in future ; it pays for what is defined as health care , but expects the county council and better-off individuals to pay for other care .
we are challenging some of our colleagues in the public sector as to whether what we are paying for , they should be paying for . ''
i think it 's a little bit dangerous to start foisting bills on the nhs . ''
author: Bob Cooper
Political reporter, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : wind turning to west after bright start
text: it is a cold start with a widespread ground frost .
there is the outside chance of a shower , which could be wintry .
the wind will become more westerly through the day , and although there 'll be sunshine at first , cloud will increase .
temperatures will climb through the day to about 7c ( 45f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : tanker breakdown slows a66
text: a broken-down tanker is partly blocking the westbound a66 near eamont bridge .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : water mains work continues on a591
text: the a591 north of keswick is still closed between the crosthwaite roundabout and the castle inn junction while a new water pipe in installed .
author: BBC News Travel
